content: In 1924, which 'Great Gatsby' author spent time living in France during the era known as the Jazz Age?

In 1924, F. Scott Fitzgerald, the author of "The Great Gatsby," spent time living in France during the era known as the Jazz Age. This period was characterized by cultural, social, and artistic dynamism, especially in the United States and Europe. Fitzgerald was part of the "Lost Generation," a group of American expatriate writers who lived in Europe during this time. His experiences in France influenced his writing and contributed to the themes explored in his works.
